comment: He is an all around good guy, but this is not the class to take if you are looking for an easy A. Tests are difficult, but he is willing to meet one on one and help you. He likes to challenge his students!!

Dr. Hieger is a good teacher. His classes are usually entertaining and easy to follow. If you take the practice quizzes online before the tests, you should do a decent job. Hes a funny teacher too. I would recommend him.

He's great!! 4 tests.. they are easy if you just read the book, and take the practice quizzes. He keeps the class fun and is very interesting/funny! Attendance not really mandatory though he does make you sign in. (you'll want to come to class) I've made a high b and then all a's on the tests. TAKE HIM!
Great teacher!! Most interesting class i have ever taken and is not boring at all. made me want to switch to a psyche major :D take him!

Very fun class!!! He was very funny, and is a great professor! The only reason why I would not take this class is the only grades you have are 4 exams. I did HORRIBLE on every exam. Fun class but very hard. If you want an easy A...look somewhere else.

He is a good professor.  If you need help, make an appointment with him and he's willing to help. I learned a lot in his class; it was a lot to take in, but if had questions, he broke it down and explained in further detail.  I recommend taking his class!!!

Excellent teacher, 100% fair. Class is focused, but he keeps it light with humor. You have to get used to his voice, but then love him. There are 3 tests, and a group presentation & paper - he's unclear on directions for those, but flexible. The tests are worth 2x the paper & presentation, but they are good tests. Very balanced. Take him for sure.

Dr. Hieger was awesome. Super nice, related to the students well and very understanding. If you take notes and go to class you can make a good grade. It does require reading, but it's school, you should have to read.

I found his lectures engaging and interesting.  They help clarify the material in the book so read the chap before class. Read the chap, study the terms, take the online quizzes and you will pass the class easily.

He is a funny professor....doesn't really care too much for excuses....you have to pay attention in class, take notes(using your book),do the book quizzes and online quizzes do well on test. He is extremely knowledgable but be prepared to study hard for test. I got an A so it's obtainable.
Great professor - I gave him a pepper because I thought he was pretty hot. Tests are fairly easy if you study frequently and use the online quizzes for prep. I made an A in the class!
Awesome. Very funny, but a little aquard. LOVE HIM! take him if you can

He has a dry sense of humor which I found funny but it went right over some people's heads. He means what he says even if it sounds like a joke. He says attendance isn't mandatory but he will count off of you're gone too many times. Participate, speak up and do the work. Not a hard grader. The class was enjoyable!
He is a great professor. He knows his stuff and it appears that he loves it.  Tests were fair.  Reading the book/making note cards/using the test review online really helps.  I would recommend him!
Great teacher for general psych!! it was interesting and he REALLY knows his stuff. i would recommend him to anyone who wants to take a path down the psychology route
It's a great class to take when you're trying to figure out what career path to take in psychology. You hear from your classmate that give a presentation on each career field every week.
He was a good teacher, lots of reading. He gives you a study guide for every test online. You have 3 tests in the semester. If you do the work it isn't that hard. I got a 93 on the first test.

Quite a bit of reading. Class participation and attendance are very important! You have to really know what you're talking about on the tests. He grades hard on essays and papers but easier on presentations. All in all an ok prof.

This class was not an easy class.I did get an A. The information learned in the class is very useful especially if you are going to grad school.Not a very exciting professor to learn from but he does know his stuff.10 reaction papers worth 10 points each I thought this was better than doing one major paper.3 exams.Take him if you want to learn.

Lectured word for word from the text and very monotone. Watching a stump rot would be more exciting than this class. Exams were all multiple choice, but were each worth more points than the last. The final was confusing considering many students agreed that several questions could have more than one correct answer. Would not take him again !

Hard class. There was not a set curriculum. Alot of changing around. There were reading reaction papers due every monday... they were VERY annoying! Tests are essays, and he expects a book for every question but doesn't allow enough time to complete. Attendence is mandatory. After two missed classes, 10 pts. are lost from grade!

I was very interested in the class and the class material. Attendence was mandatory. He lectured straight from the text book, word for word. Literally. He was very monotone. There were three tests, the first worth 75 pts., second worth 100 pts, and third worth 125 points. The third test was harder than the first two! Which hurt ppls final grades!

Interesting class. He can be boring at times but throws in humor to lighten the mood. Tests are somewhat difficult and the grading is weird. There are 3 tests and each one is worth more than the one before. Also little reading assignments to help with grade. Attendance is mandatory and he means it! It reflects on your grade a lot if you miss class!
Way too detail oriented, exams were essay questions which required impossibly long answers.

Very anal. Attendance is a huge part of your grade and he counts you absent if you leave early or are 5 minutes late! If you turn in an assignment and leave, he cuts your grade in half. Must bring a photo ID and remove jackets/hats to take any test. Talking with others during class or monopolizing discussion is considered disrupting behavior!

Class was very interesting.  Lots of reading involved. An Autobiography and 4 tests, each of which had essays.  Anywhere from 2-4 essays on each test. He takes a long time to get grades back to you, but he grades fairly and is very helpful. Didn't get autobiography grade back until the day before the final.

Lots of reading, group presentation every week,thinking outside the box, only 5 grades(attendance,participation,midterm,paper,final) Grades paper extremely hard. Types in every source you use on your paper and grades from there. Also, does not give you your grade on the paper before the final. go into final without knowing 1/2 your grade. TERRIBLE!
